verses.verse: The oracle <WH4853> which Habakkuk <WH2265> the prophet <WH5030> saw. <WH2372>
Yahweh, <WH3068> how long will I cry, <WH7768> and you will not hear? <WH8085> I cry out <WH2199> to you <WH2555> "Violence!" and will you not save? <WH3467>

Why do you show <WH7200> me iniquity, <WH205> and look <WH5027> at perversity? <WH5999> For destruction <WH7701> and violence <WH2555> are before me. <WH7379> There is strife, and contention <WH4066> rises up. <WH5375>

Therefore the law <WH8451> is paralyzed, <WH6313> and justice <WH4941> never <WH5331> goes forth; <WH3318> for the wicked <WH7563> surround <WH3803> the righteous; <WH6662> therefore justice <WH4941> goes forth <WH3318> perverted. <WH6127>

"Look <WH7200> among the nations, <WH1471> watch, <WH5027> and wonder <WH8539> marvelously; <WH8539> for I am working <WH6466> a work <WH6466> in your days, <WH3117> which you will not believe <WH539> though it is told you. <WH5608>

For, <WH6965> behold, I raise up the Chaldeans, <WH3778> that bitter <WH4751> and hasty <WH4116> nation, <WH1471> that march <WH1980> through the breadth <WH4800> of the earth, <WH776> to possess <WH3423> dwelling places that are not theirs. <WH4908>
They are feared <WH366> and dreaded. <WH3372> Their judgment <WH4941> and their dignity <WH7613> proceed from themselves. <WH3318>

Their horses <WH5483> also are swifter <WH7043> than leopards, <WH5246> and are more fierce <WH2300> than the evening <WH6153> wolves. <WH2061> Their horsemen <WH6571> press proudly <WH6335> on. <WH6571> Yes, their horsemen come <WH935> from afar. <WH7350> They fly <WH5774> as an eagle <WH5404> that hurries <WH2363> to devour. <WH398>
All of them come <WH935> for violence. <WH2555> Their hordes <WH4041> face <WH6440> the desert. <WH6921> He gathers <WH622> prisoners <WH7628> like sand. <WH2344>

Yes, <WH7046> he scoffs at kings, <WH4428> and princes <WH7336> are a derision <WH4890> to him. <WH7832> He laughs at every stronghold, <WH4013> for he builds <WH6651> up an earthen <WH6083> ramp, <WH3920> and takes it.
Then he sweeps <WH2498> by like the wind, <WH7307> and goes on. <WH5674> He is indeed guilty, <WH816> whose <WH2098> strength <WH3581> is his god. <WH433>"

Aren't <WH6924> you from everlasting, Yahweh <WH3068> my God, <WH430> my Holy One? <WH6918> We will not die. <WH4191> Yahweh, <WH3068> you have appointed <WH7760> him for judgment. <WH4941> You, <WH6697> Rock, have established <WH3245> him to punish. <WH3198>

You who have purer <WH2889> eyes <WH5869> than to see <WH7200> evil, <WH7451> and who cannot <WH3201> look <WH5027> on perversity, <WH5999> why do you tolerate <WH5027> those who deal treacherously, <WH898> and keep silent <WH2790> when the wicked <WH7563> swallows <WH1104> up the man who is more righteous than he, <WH6662>
and make <WH6213> men <WH120> like the fish <WH1709> of the sea, <WH3220> like the creeping things, <WH7431> that have no ruler over them? <WH4910>

He takes up <WH5927> all of them with the hook. <WH2443> He catches <WH1641> them in his net, <WH2764> and gathers <WH622> them in his dragnet. <WH4365> Therefore he rejoices <WH8055> and is glad. <WH1523>

Therefore he sacrifices <WH2076> to his net, <WH2764> and burns incense <WH6999> to his dragnet, <WH4365> because by them <WH1992> his life <WH2506> is luxurious, <WH8082> and his food <WH2506> is good. <WH1277>
Will he therefore continually <WH8548> empty <WH7324> his net, <WH2764> and kill <WH2026> the nations <WH1471> without mercy? <WH2550>
